questions.question: …………………….. she know what she is doing?
questions.description: She is singular subject. Hence, we use does here.

questions.question: ……………………… forget to give me a call before you leave.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences. In imperatives the subject is you.

questions.question: ………………………… your shoes before entering the temple.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentence.

questions.question: She ……………………………. harder than anybody I know.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: He was a true patriot who …………………….. for his country.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: Sam ………………………. a good job.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to give news.

questions.question: Don’t phone them now. They …………………………. dinner.
She ………………………. to him for thirty years.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about life experiences up to now.

questions.question: Somebody has ……………………… my purse?
questions.description: Stolen is the past participle of steal.
